intro: Anarthrophyllum brevistipula, commonly known as the short-tipped flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are typically greenish or reddish in color. Anarthrophyllum brevistipula is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
